conclusion: Analyze the graph showing variation of square of velocities with displacement to determine which car has greater acceleration.
Equation for uniform accelerated motion: v^2 = v_0^2 + 2ax.
Both cars start from rest, so v_0 = 0, simplifying to v^2 = 2ax.
Graph represents a straight line through origin with slope v^2/2a.
Slope of line on v^2 versus x plot is v^2/2a.
Both lines pass through the origin.
Slope of line A is calculated as 2.
Slope of line B is calculated as 1.
For Line A, slope 2 implies a_A = v^2/4.
For Line B, slope 1 implies a_B = v^2/2.
Comparing a_A and a_B shows a_B > a_A.
Car B has the greater acceleration.
